module.name: rawEthernet Modtronix SBC68EC test module
module.description: This module inplements a node with 4 digital inputs, 7 digital outputs, 4 10-bit A/D inputs, 1 10-bit PWM output and a VSCP enabled serial interface. The SBC68EC module also have a VSCP enabled CAN interface.

reg.name: Zone
reg.description: Zone this module belongs to

reg.name: Subzone
reg.description:
Subzone this module belongs to. Subzone base for I/O. Lowest 5 bits should be zero (ignored) and are used for I/O pins and other zoned functionality.
 
 0 - General subzone for module.
 
 1 - subzone for Input 0.
 2 - subzone for Input 1.
 3 - subzone for Input 2.
 4 - subzone for Input 3.
 5 - Reserved.
 6 - Reserved.
 7 - Reserved.
 8 - Reserved.
 
 9 - subzone for Output 0.
 10 - subzone for Output 1.
 11 - subzone for Output 2.
 12 - subzone for Output 3.
 13 - subzone for Output 4.
 14 - subzone for Output 5.
 15 - subzone for Output 6.
 16 - Reserved.
 
 17 - subzone for pin PWM Output.
 
 18 - subzone for A/D 0.
 19 - subzone for A/D 1.
 20 - subzone for A/D 2.
 21 - subzone for A/D 3.
 22 - Reserved.
 23 - Reserved.
 24 - Reserved.
 25 - Reserved.
 
 26 - Subzone for serial channel.
 
 27 - Subzone for CAN channel.
 
 28 - Reserved.
 29 - Reserved.
 30 - Reserved.
 31 - Reserved.

reg.name: Reserved
reg.description: This register is reserved for future use.

reg.name: Subzone
reg.description: Module Control Register. Note on PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT\n If you want to write just a persitent value for the PWM and after that current PWM values that should not be persistent. Enable this bit, write a value and the reset the bit again. This will load the PWM with the value written when the bit was set on the next startup.\n For Output/Input events CLASS1.DATA TYPE=1 (I/O) is sent with data coding set to 0x20 This means the frame get the content 0x20 in it's first byte and output status in it' second byte.

bit.name: Vref- selection
bit.description: Enable external Vref- on RA2.

bit.name: Vref+ selection
bit.description: Enable external Vref+ on RA3.

bit.name: PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT
bit.description: Make PWM value persistent.

bit.name: ENABLE_PERIODIC_OUTPUT_EVENTS
bit.description: Enable Output periodic events.

bit.name: ENABLE_PERIODIC_INPUT_EVENTS
bit.description: Enable Input periodic events.

reg.name: Reserved
reg.description: Auto event interval in seconds. Set to 0 to disable autoevents.

reg.name: Input status
reg.description: Current input status for input bits 0-7.

reg.name: Output status
reg.description: Current output status for input bits 0-7.

reg.name: A/D periodic
reg.description: A/D Control Register periodic events control register. Set corresponding bit in this register to enable periodic events.

reg.name: A/D alarm low.
reg.description: Aanalog to digital control register for low alarm. Set corresponding bit in this register to enable low alarm. This means an alarm event will be sendt out when the corresponding A/D channel has a value below a certain value.

reg.name: A/D alarm high.
reg.description: Aanalog to digital control register for high alarm. Set corresponding bit in this register to enable high alarm. That means an alarm event will be sent out when a high A/D value has been exceeded.

reg.name: Output Control Register 0
reg.description: The output control bits enable disable intelligent output functionality.

bit.name: Initial state
bit.description: Initial startup state for output channel.\n 1 = high, 0=low.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Protection timer enable.
bit.description: If this bit is set to one a protection timer will reset it if it has not been externally reseted before a timeout period.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: If set to one the output is enabled. Disabled output stays at initial state.

reg.name: Output protection timer 0 MSB
reg.description: This is the most significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed. Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.name: Output protection timer 0 LSB
reg.description: This is the least significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed. Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.description: This is the most significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed. Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.description: Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 0

reg.description: Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 1

reg.name: A/D converter 3 LSB
reg.description: Least significant byte for analog to digital converter 3

reg.name: PWM value MSB.
reg.description: Most significant byte for the pwm channel. The read/written value is in the range 0-1023. Both values has to be written to actually set the PWM. The data is transfered to the PWM register when the LSB byte is written. The value here is normally not persistent so a reset will write zero. However it is possible to make it persistent by enabling the PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT in the module control register. Values greater the 0x3ff written to the PWMregisters will be masked to appropriate value.

reg.name: PWM value LSB.
reg.description: Least significant byte for the pwm channel. The read/written value is in the range 0-1023. Both values has to be written to actually set the PWM. The data is transfered to the PWM register when the LSB byte is written. The value here is normally not persistent so a reset will write zero. However it is possible to make it persistent by enabling the PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT in the module control register. Values greater the 0x3ff written to the PWMregisters will be masked to appropriate value.

reg.name: Serial channel control register
reg.description: This register is used to set communication parameters for the serial channel.

bit.name: Baudrate
bit.description:
Baudrate for the serial channel/description>
http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/rawethernet#serial_channel
300 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 300 baud.
1200 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 1200 baud.
2400 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 2400 baud.
4800 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 4800 baud.
9600 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 9600 baud.
19200 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 19200 baud.
38400 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 38400 baud.
57600 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 57600 baud.
115200 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 115200 baud.
230400 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 230400 baud.
460800 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 460800 baud.
921600 Baud Set serial communicationspeed to 921600 baud.

reg.description: This register has control bits for the serial channel.

bit.name: Enable confirm events.
bit.description: Enable confirm events.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved for future use.

bit.name: Enable serial stream to channel.
bit.description: Enable serial stream events output to serial channel.

bit.name: Enable serial stream from channel.
bit.description: Enable serial stream events on input from serial channel.

bit.name: Serial port open.
bit.description: Port open status. Set to one to open zero to close port. Read to see if open/closed.

bit.name: Serial persistent open.
bit.description: Persistent open/close. Set state for port when board is started.

reg.name: A/D min value 0 MSB.
reg.description: Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected.

reg.description: Minimum value for analog to digital converter. If low alarm is enables an alarm event will be sent when a value below this point is detected.

Alarm hysteresis
Alarm hysteresis for high and low A/D alarms are set in this register.
rw
CAN control register
Bits in this register control the behaviour of the CAN channel.
rw
CAN bitrate.
Bitrate for CAN channel.
10 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 10 kbps.
20 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 20 kbps.
50 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 50 kbps.
100 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 100 kbps.
125 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 125 kbps.
250 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 250 kbps.
500 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 500 kbps.
800 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 800 kbps.
1000 kbps Set CAN bitrate to 1000 kbps.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
CAN open status
CAN channel open status. Set to one to open zero to close channel. Read to see if open/closed.
CAN persistent open
Persistent open/close. Set state for channel when board is started.

Output protection timer 0
This is the least significant byte for the output protection timer. An output will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.
http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/modules/nova#output_protection_time_registers
rw

A/D Converter 0
Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read.
r
A/D Converter 1
Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read.
r
A/D Converter 2
Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read.
r
A/D Converter 3
Read only register for 10-bit A/D converter. A value in the range 0-1023 is read.
r
PWM channel 0
Value for PWM 0 channel. The value here is normally not persistent so a reset will write zero. However it is possible to make it persistent by enabling the PWM_PERSISTENT_BIT in the module control register. Values greater the 0x3ff (1023) written to the PWMregisters will be masked to appropriate value.

CAN 32-bit mask
Mask for 32-bit CAN id that together with the mask filters the traffic to the interface.
rw
CAN 32-bit filter
Filter for 32-bit CAN id that together with the filter filters the traffic to the interface.
rw
GUID for CAN channel
GUID for CAN channel. This is a full GUID without the least significant byte which is used as a nickname id for units on the CAN bus. Events sent from the CAN bus is translated using the nickname and this GUID. Events sent to this GUID is is sent out on the CAN bus usning the least significant byte as the nickname.
rw
A/D High/Low Alarm.
A/D High/Low Alarm. Read status register to reset.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Reserved
This bit is reserved for future use.
Alarm condition.
Alarm condition has occurred. Lower bits indicates whta has happened. Read alarm register to reset.
http://www.vscp.org/wiki/doku.php/rawethernet#available_actions
2
16 32
NOOP No operation
Activate output(s)
Activate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on. Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.
Activation array
A bit array where a bit should be set for bits at output that should be activated.
Activate output(s)
Deactivate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on. Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.
Activation array
A bit array where bit should be set for bits at output that should be deactivated.
Send serial data
Send data in argument on serial port. Data should be NULL terminated.
Serial data
A zero terminated string that is sent on the serial channel.
Send file
Send data if file on filesystem. The file should be compiled in as on of the files that build up the web pages.
Datafile
Filename for datafile on filesystem.
Open serial port
Open serial port
Close serial port
Close serial port
Open CAN port
Open CAN port
Close CAN port
Close CAN port
Send data in argument on CAN port
Send data in argument on CAN port.\n Argument Byte 0 - MSB of CLASS ( Level I class can be max 511 )\n Argument Byte 1 - LSB of CLASS\n Argument Byte 2 - MSB of TYPE\n Argument Byte 3 - LSB of TYPE\n Argument Byte 4 - LSB of TYPE\n Argument Byte 5 - Datacount (0-8)\n Argument Byte 6-13 - data\n
Send Output status.
Send Output status. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 0 and so on. ON/OFF events are sent.
Send Input status.
Send Input status. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is input 0 and so on. ON/OFF events are sent.
Send A/D value(s).
Send A/D value(s). The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is A/D 0 and so on. A/D event is sent.
Send Output status.
Send Output status. I/O event is sent instead of ON/OFF events as of above.
Send Input status.
Send Input status. I/O event is sent instead of ON/OFF events as of above.
ROM Write
Set PWM as of argument. Byte 0 is MSB, Byte 1 is LSB.
On event
If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its active state.
Index Always set to zero.
Zone The zone for the input/output.
subzone The subzone for the input/output.
Off event
If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its inactive state.
Index Always set to zero.
Zone The zone for the input/output.
subzone The subzone for the input/output.
Stopped
If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its inactive state.
Index Always set to zero.
Zone The zone for the input/output.
subzone The subzone for the input/output.
Started
If enabled the event is sent when a input/output goes to its active state.
Index Always set to zero.
Zone The zone for the input/output.
subzone The subzone for the input/output.
Alarm
If enabled the event is sent when a output goes to its low state after a protection timer have timed out or when an input goes to a triggered state.
Index Always set to zero.
Zone The zone for the input/output.
subzone The subzone for the input/output.
I/O value
I/O measurements are sent with this event.
Datacoding
The datacoding is set to integer and is 0b01100xxx where xxx = 0 for inputs and xxx = 1 for outputs.
I/O value The actual data as a single byte integer.
A/D value
A/D measurements are sent with this event.
Datacoding
The datacoding is set to integer and is 0b01100xxx where xxx is index for A/D converter.
A/D value MSB MSB of A/D reading.
A/D value LSB LSB of A/D reading.
Node Heartbeat
Node heartbeat send out.
Index
Always set to zero.
Zone Module zone.
Subzone 0 (subzone for module).
Stream Data with zone.
Use this event to send serial data to the serial channel of the module. Also this event is sent from the module when data is received on the serial channel. Confirm events are sent when stream data is received.
Zone Module zone.
Subzone Subzone for serial channel.
Sequency number
The sequency number is iincrease for every event of this type that is sent.
Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent.
Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent.
Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent.
Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent.
Serial data If serial data is available filled with that data else absent.
